description.narrative: The Health Service Provision Facility initiative aims to strengthen the health sector in Papua New Guinea (PNG) as a result of the PNG and Australia Partnership for Development (P4D) 2008 between the Government of Australia and the Government of PNG (GoPNG) which agrees to achieve improved development outcomes and sustainable improvements in the quality of life of all Papua New Guineans. In June 2010 the two governments signed a health schedule to the partnership which aims to bring improved primary health care services to almost 90% of PNG citizens who live in rural areas. In December 2010 a new direction for the Australian Aid Program in PNG was approved with a specific focus on service delivery. With this new direction AusAID revised its approach to the health sector to focus on five key areas we believe are the best opportunities to support PNG to deliver better outcomes.
